Package com.leakyabstractions.result

Class Results

java.lang.Object
com.leakyabstractions.result.Results
public class Results
extends Object
This class consists exclusively of static methods that operate on or return Result instances.
Author:
Guillermo Calvo

      Create a new successful result with a given value.
      Type Parameters:

      F - the type of the failure value
      Parameters:
      success - the value to be contained; may be null
      Returns:

    • ofNullable

      public static <S> Result<S,​Void> ofNullable​(S value)
      Create a new result based on a possibly null value.

      If the given value is not null then a new successful result containing the value will be created; otherwise a new failed result will be created.

      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be contained; may be null
      Returns:
      the new result

    • ofNullable

      public static <S,​ F> Result<S,​F> ofNullable​(S value, Supplier<? extends F> failureSupplier)
      Create a new result based on a possibly null value and a function that supplies failure values.

      If the given value is not null then a new successful result containing the value will be created; otherwise a new failed result containing the value produced by the Supplier will be created.

      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      F - the type of the failure value
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be contained if not null
      failureSupplier - a Supplier that will generate the failure value if value is null
      Returns:
      the new result

    • ofOptional

      public static <S> Result<S,​Void> ofOptional​(Optional<S> value)
      Create a new result based on a possibly empty Optional.

      If the given optional is not empty then a new successful result containing the value will be created; otherwise a new failed result will be created.

      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      Parameters:
      value - the optional whose value is to be contained; may be empty
      Returns:
      the new result

    • ofOptional

      public static <S,​ F> Result<S,​F> ofOptional​(Optional<S> value, Supplier<? extends F> failureSupplier)
      Create a new result based on a possibly empty Optional and a function that supplies failure values.

      If the given optional is not empty then a new successful result containing the value will be created; otherwise a new failed result containing the value produced by the Supplier will be created.

      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      F - the type of the failure value
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be contained if not null
      failureSupplier - a Supplier that will generate the failure value if value is empty
      Returns:
      the new result

    • wrap

      public static <S> Result<S,​Exception> wrap​(Callable<S> callable)
      Create a new result based on a Callable.

      If the given Callable completes then a new successful result containing the produced value will be created; otherwise a new failed result containing the thrown exception will be created.

      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      Parameters:
      callable - the Callable to produce the success value, may throw an exception
      Returns:
      the new result

    • wrap

      public static <S,​ F> Result<S,​F> wrap​(Callable<S> callable, Function<? super Exception,​F> exceptionMapper)
      Create a new result based on a Callable and a mapping function that generates failure values.

      If the given {code Callable} completes then a new successful result containing the produced value will be created; otherwise a new failed result containing the thrown exception will be created.

      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      F - the type of the failure value
      Parameters:
      callable - the {code Callable} to produce the success value, may throw an exception
      exceptionMapper - a mapping Function that will generate the failure value if the Callable throws an exception
      Returns:
      the new result

    • combine

      public static <S,​ F> Result<Stream<S>,​Stream<F>> combine​(Collection<Result<S,​F>> results)
      Create a new result based on a Collection of Result objects.

      If there's any failed result inside the collection then a new failed result containing a stream of failure values will be created; otherwise a new successful result containing a stream of success values will be created.

      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      F - the type of the failure value
      Parameters:
      results - a Collection of Result objects, may be empty.
      Returns:
      the new result

    • combine

      @SafeVarargs public static <S,​ F> Result<Stream<S>,​Stream<F>> combine​(Result<? extends S,​? extends F>... results)
      Create a new result based on a variable list of Result objects.

      If there's any failed result inside the variable list then a new failed result containing a stream of failure values will be created; otherwise a new successful result containing a stream of success values will be created.

      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      F - the type of the failure value
      Parameters:
      results - a variable list of Result objects, may be empty.
      Returns:
      the new result

    • toOptional

      public static <S> Optional<S> toOptional​(Result<S,​?> result)
      Return an Optional object with the success value if the given result is successful and the success value is not null; otherwise return an empty Optional.
      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      Parameters:
      result - the result whose success value is to be
      Returns:
      an Optional object with the success value if the given result is successful and the success value is not null; otherwise an empty Optional

    • toOptionalFailure

      public static <F> Optional<F> toOptionalFailure​(Result<?,​F> result)
      Return an Optional object with the failure value if the given result is failed and the failure value is not null; otherwise return an empty Optional.
      Type Parameters:
      F - the type of the failure value
      Parameters:
      result - the result whose failure value is to be
      Returns:
      an Optional object with the failure value if the given result is failed and the failure value is not null; otherwise an empty Optional

    • lazy

      public static <S,​ F> Result<S,​F> lazy​(Supplier<Result<S,​F>> supplier)
      Create a new lazy result based on the given result supplier.

      Lazy results can be manipulated just like any other result; they will try to defer the invocation of the given supplier as long as possible. The purpose is to encapsulate an expensive operation that may be omitted if there's no actual need to examine the result.

      These results can be lazily filtered and transformed without actually performing the expensive operation:

      • Result.filter(java.util.function.Predicate, Function)
      • Result.map(Function, Function)
      • Result.mapSuccess(Function)
      • Result.mapFailure(Function)
      • Result.flatMap(Function, Function)
      • Result.flatMapSuccess(Function)
      • Result.flatMapFailure(Function)

      On the other hand, the supplier will be invoked if any of these terminal operations is performed on a lazy result:

      • Result.isSuccess()
      • Result.isFailure()
      • Result.orElse(Object)
      • Result.orElseMap(Function)
      • Result.orElseThrow()
      • Result.orElseThrow(Function)
      • Result.getFailureOrElseThrow()

      Finally, conditional actions can be performed lazily if they are LazyConsumer objects; otherwise they will be performed immediately:

      • Result.ifSuccess(Consumer)
      • Result.ifSuccessOrElse(Consumer, Consumer)
      • Result.ifFailure(Consumer)

      Once a lazy result retrieves the supplied result, all future operations will be performed immediately and the returned Result objects might not be lazy.

      The supplier is guaranteed to be invoked at most once. It must return a non-null result object; if it throws an exception or returns null then the behavior of the lazy result will be undefined.

      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of the success value
      F - the type of the failure value
      Parameters:
      supplier - the function that will eventually supply the actual result
      Returns:
      the new lazy result
      See Also:
      lazy(Consumer)

    • lazy

      public static <T> LazyConsumer<T> lazy​(Consumer<T> consumer)
      Creates a new lazy consumer based on a regular one.

      Lazy consumers are intended to be passed as parameters to Result.ifSuccess(Consumer), Result.ifSuccessOrElse(Consumer, Consumer) and Result.ifFailure(Consumer) when the action only needs to be performed if the lazy result eventually retrieves an actual result from its supplier.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input to the action
      Parameters:
      consumer - the regular consumer that may be eventually performed
      Returns:
      the new lazy consumer
      See Also:
      LazyConsumer
